2.96.text:
The World to Come. The Restored Church of
God presents David C. Pack. Answering life’s

9.46.text:
greatest questions straight from the Bible,
and announcing the wonderful good news of

17.17.text:
Millions keep New Year's without knowing why---or
where it originated. While some question its

23.69.text:
observance, of course most see nothing wrong
with such a celebration.

27.92.text:
Have you ever considered---much less investigated---why
you believe and practice what you do? The

35.14.text:
world is filled with endless customs and traditions.
Yet few seek to understand---to research---the

41.87.text:
origin of things. Most go along with popular
practices without question, choosing to do

47.89.text:
what everyone else does simply because it
is easier. The majority hold the same beliefs

53.34.text:
they learned in childhood, assuming what they
believe and do is right. They take their beliefs

59.71.text:
for granted and never take time to truly study
or prove them.

64.99.text:
Should true Christians---whose calling and
goal is to imitate the perfect life of Jesus

70.58.text:
Christ---celebrate New Year's? Should they
be caught up in the excitement? What could

75.62.text:
be wrong with "ringing out the old and ringing
in the new"? What is the origin of this holiday?

83.50.text:
What does God say about it? You will be surprised
to learn the truth that ministers of professing

90.30.text:
Christianity either do not know---or will
not teach.

96.10.text:
Before looking at what the Bible says about
New Year's, we must first examine the history

100.44.text:
of this popular holiday. Notice this from
the Encyclopaedia Britannica: "The earliest-known

106.44.text:
record of a New Year festival dates from about
2000 BC in Mesopotamia, where in Babylonia

113.83.text:
the New Year (Akitu) began with the new moon
after the spring equinox (mid March) and in

120.29.text:
Assyria with the new moon nearest the autumn
equinox (mid September)."

125.77.text:
Now this from the Encyclopedia Americana:
"New Year's Day, the first day of the year.

132.14.text:
Among ancient peoples the beginning of the
year was determined by one of various events,

137.28.text:
such as the spring or autumnal equinox or
the winter or summer solstice. In Egypt, for

143.61.text:
example, beginning about 2773 BC, the year
began with the heliacal rising of Sirius,

150.90.text:
which coincided with the start of the flood
period of the Nile and came not long after

155.26.text:
the summer solstice." The Ancient Egyptians,
Phoenicians and Persians began their new year

161.51.text:
with the autumn equinox (September 21), while
the Greeks, until the 5th century BC, observed

173.06.text:
The World Book states, "Many ancient peoples…performed
rituals to do away with the past and purify

179.38.text:
themselves for the new year. For example,
some people put out the fires they were using

185.15.text:
and started new ones." The Celts celebrated
the new year on November 1, marking the end

191.48.text:
of summer and the harvest, and the beginning
of the cold, dark winter ahead. (This was

196.19.text:
a precursor to Halloween.) They built sacred
bonfires to scare off evil spirits and to

202.86.text:
honor their sun god.
Also notice this: "In early times, the ancient

208.34.text:
Romans gave each other New Year's gifts of
branches from sacred trees. In later years,

214.58.text:
they gave gold-covered nuts or coins imprinted
with pictures of Janus, the god of gates,

220.76.text:
doors, and beginnings. January was named after
Janus, who had two faces---one looking forward

227.42.text:
and the other looking backward."
Here is more from the Encyclopaedia Britannica:

233.14.text:
"By the Roman republican calendar, the year
began on March 1; after 153 BC the official

240.93.text:
date was January 1, and this was confirmed
by the Julian calendar (46 BC)…In early

247.46.text:
medieval times most of Christian Europe regarded
March 25 (Annunciation Day) as the beginning

253.75.text:
of the year, though for Anglo-Saxon England
New Year's Day was Dec. 25."

260.47.text:
Since Roman Catholic leaders falsely believed
that Jesus was born December 25, they assumed

267.04.text:
His mother Mary conceived Him on March 25,
9 months before. Let's read: "March 25th is

274.23.text:
called the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin
Mary…It celebrates the occasion when the

279.20.text:
Archangel Gabriel appeared to the young Jewish
maiden and announced to her that she was to

284.57.text:
be the mother of Jesus…Although the Church
began very early to commemorate this event,

289.75.text:
the date itself cannot have been fixed before
the date of Christmas was established, which

294.78.text:
was sometime late in the fourth century. The
two dates are dependent on each other, because

299.92.text:
they must normally have been 9 months apart…Then,
reaching all the way back, people decided

305.70.text:
that this was not only the day on which Christ's
earthly life began---it was the day everything

311.82.text:
began, the day of Creation itself. From here
it was a very short step---an almost unavoidable

317.94.text:
one---to the idea that March 25th must be
the beginning of the year, and from the 12th

323.29.text:
century until the calendar reform in 1752,
March 25th was New Year's day."

330.23.text:
These historical accounts make clear that
the history of New Year's Eve and New Year's

334.46.text:
Day is deeply rooted in pagan traditions.
It originated in the minds of men---pagan

341.22.text:
idol-worshippers---and it slowly developed
over the centuries.

345.71.text:
Now notice what God thinks about New Year's,
and any holiday that has its roots in pagan

351.14.text:
practices, customs and traditions. You will
be shocked.

355.74.text:
We begin with Jeremiah 10: "Learn not the
way of the heathen…for the customs of the

363.05.text:
people are vain." This is a plain command
from God---in your Bible. Thruout His Word,

370.91.text:
God describes "the heathen" as those who worship
nature (the sun, moon, stars, trees, etc.),

377.13.text:
or manmade idols, or anything but the One
True God. God calls such people and their

382.78.text:
practices heathen. Men call them pagan. Christians
know that God hates all customs, practices

390.50.text:
and traditions that have pagan roots.
How serious is God about paganism? Follow

396.47.text:
the next few passages carefully. When He rescued
the 12 tribes of Israel from Egypt and led

402.26.text:
them out of brutal slavery, He commanded,
"After the doings of the land of Egypt, where

408.42.text:
in you dwelt, you shall not do: and after
the doings of the land of Canaan, where I

414.00.text:
bring you, shall you not do: neither shall
you walk in… [men's] ordinances." In verses

421.61.text:
24-29, God told the Israelites not to defile
themselves with the practices and customs

428.27.text:
of the surrounding nations. And also, "Therefore
shall you keep My ordinance, that you commit

434.46.text:
not any one of these abominable customs, which
were committed before you, and that you defile

440.11.text:
not yourselves therein: I am the Lord your
God."

445.66.text:
God cursed Egypt with 10 plagues and freed
Israel from slavery. He parted the Red Sea

450.88.text:
and led them to safety. He fed them manna
from heaven, protected them from battle-tested

456.22.text:
Gentile armies, delivered them into the Promised
Land, and drove out their enemies. How did

461.76.text:
Israel treat God in turn? "Our fathers understood
not Your wonders in Egypt; they remembered

468.19.text:
not the multitude of Your mercies; but provoked
Him…at the Red Sea…They soon forgot His

474.47.text:
works; they waited not for His counsel: but
lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and

479.28.text:
tempted God in the desert…They made a calf
in Horeb, and worshiped the molten image.

485.74.text:
Thus they changed their glory [the true God]
into the similitude of an ox that eats grass.

492.95.text:
They forgot God their Savior, which had done
great things in Egypt; wondrous works in the

499.13.text:
land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red
Sea…they despised the pleasant land, they

505.47.text:
believed not His word: but murmured in their
tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of

512.07.text:
the Lord…They joined themselves also unto
Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

517.48.text:
Thus they provoked Him to anger with their
intentions."

522.32.text:
God had explicitly commanded Israel to cast
out and utterly destroy all nations that occupied

528.88.text:
the Promised Land of Canaan. Above all, they
were not to make political alliances with

534.47.text:
them or marry into their families. (Read Deut.
7:1-5, 16.) Why? "For they will turn away

543.45.text:
your sons from following Me, that they may
serve other gods."

550.15.text:
But the Israelites---who thought they knew
better than God---decided to do things their

554.73.text:
own way. The picture is awful: "They did not
destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord

560.71.text:
commanded them: but were mingled among the
heathen, and learned their works: and they

566.26.text:
served their idols: which were a snare unto
them. Yes, they sacrificed their sons and

571.95.text:
their daughters unto [demons]. And shed innocent
blood, even the blood of their sons and…daughters,

577.86.text:
whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan:
and the land was polluted with blood. Thus

584.78.text:
they were defiled with their own works, and
went whoring with their own inventions."

590.44.text:
To wake Israel up and get her back on track
to being the model nation He had always intended,

595.91.text:
God gave Israel over to their enemies. Israel
repented. God rescued them. Then Israel pursued

602.18.text:
other gods again. God punished them again.
Israel repented again. So went the deliverance-idolatry-punishment-repentance

610.18.text:
cycle (vs. 40-46), until finally, God had
no other choice but to divorce unfaithful

618.01.text:
Israel. (Read Jer. 3:6-11.) He used the Assyrians
to invade, conquer, relocate and enslave the

627.13.text:
northern kingdom of Israel (II Kings 17),
which "disappeared" into history, having forgotten

634.07.text:
their true national identity. (Even today,
the modern descendants of those 10 lost tribes

639.63.text:
do not understand who they are.) Later, God
sent the southern kingdom of Judah into Babylonian

646.54.text:
exile (II Kings 24 and 25). My crucial book
America and Britain in Prophecy offers a tremendous

654.94.text:
amount of proof explaining who these tribes
are, where they have been thru history---and

660.78.text:
why this is so important for you to understand.
Captivity came because Israel lusted after

667.12.text:
pagan customs, rituals, traditions and ways.
After examining the previous scriptures, it

673.06.text:
becomes obvious that God does not take pagan
practices lightly.

678.14.text:
True Christians know that "God is not the
author of confusion but of peace." The Greek

684.07.text:
word for "confusion" also means instability,
disorder, commotion, tumult---words that aptly

691.49.text:
describe New Year's chaotic history. For thousands
of years, men kept changing their New Year

697.48.text:
from spring to fall, from March 1st to January
1st (and in some cases, Dec. 25), to March

704.54.text:
25th, back to January 1st again---the dead
of winter!

710.48.text:
Notice Merriam-Webster's Encyclopedia of World
Religions: "January 1 was restored as New

716.71.text:
Year's Day by the Gregorian calendar (1582),
immediately adopted by Roman Catholic countries.

723.92.text:
Other countries slowly followed suit: Scotland,
1660; Germany and Denmark, about 1700; England,

732.02.text:
1752; Sweden, 1753; and Russia, 1918."
Even today, men cannot agree on the date.

741.39.text:
Notice: "Chinese New Year is celebrated officially
for a month beginning in late January or early

747.35.text:
February," and "The Muslim New Year falls
on the first day of the month of Muharram

753.37.text:
and commemorates the date of the Hegira (July
16, 622 [A.D.], on the Gregorian calendar),

760.34.text:
the starting point of the Muslim calendar.
Since the Muslim year is a lunar one consisting

765.23.text:
of only 354 days, the commencement of the
new year fluctuates widely by the Western

772.30.text:
calendar." The Vietnamese New Year, Tet, falls
sometime between January 21 and February 20.

780.09.text:
And, "...the Jewish New Year…is observed
during September or early October. Hindus

786.34.text:
in different parts of India celebrate the
new year on various dates." This is what happens

791.95.text:
when people insist on following their own
judgment rather than trusting the One who

796.64.text:
designed the entire universe and everything
in it.

800.89.text:
Not only is the history of New Year's confusing
and chaotic, but so is the holiday itself.

807.12.text:
During New Year's celebrations, people let
go of all inhibition---and many times self-respect---and

812.46.text:
go wild. They use drugs, overdrink, practice
free sex---and with those they barely know.

820.55.text:
These sudden actions often yield life-long
repercussions. They shoot guns to "ring in

827.01.text:
the new year." Common sense is thrown away
in order to have a good time. Usually, the

832.81.text:
only thing people regret are next-day hangovers.
In 2007, the U.S. National Highway Traffic

840.22.text:
Safety Administration released a report revealing
that the number of deaths as a result of alcohol-impaired

846.86.text:
drivers greatly increases between the Christmas
and New Year's holidays. The average number

853.45.text:
of drunk driving deaths between 2001 and 2005
was 36 a day. This number grows 50 percent

861.67.text:
during Christmas and New Year's!
Notice also: "On average from 2001 to 2005

867.88.text:
(the last year for which complete data is
available), about 40 percent of all fatalities

874.24.text:
during the Christmas and New Year holiday
periods have occurred in crashes where at

878.45.text:
least one of the involved drivers was alcohol-impaired…"
Another source added, "38 percent of all traffic

886.29.text:
fatalities during the Christmas period occurred
in crashes involving a drunk driver or motorcycle

891.52.text:
rider and 41 percent during the New Year's
period…This compares with 31 percent for

897.56.text:
the year as a whole."
The World Book of 2010 records that when America

902.33.text:
was still in its infancy, "Many American colonists
in New England celebrated the new year by

908.39.text:
firing guns into the air and shouting." Sadly,
this tradition still exists in parts of the

913.84.text:
United States. Few think about how their actions,
combined with gravity, can have a deadly effect.

921.16.text:
What goes up (bullets) must come down somewhere.
A recent example of this was New Year's Eve

928.57.text:
of January 2010, when the Daily Mail of Britain
reported that a four-year-old boy was suddenly

934.75.text:
killed by a bullet while sitting with his
parents at a church service. The wound was

939.73.text:
gaping. Experts believe the shot, which came
thru the roof of the church, was fired from

944.70.text:
an AK-47 assault rifle more than two miles
away! On New Year's Eve in 2005, two people

952.51.text:
were struck in different parts of downtown
Atlanta by stray bullets. One hit a woman

957.50.text:
in the head. In Puerto Rico, it is said that
so many guns are fired on New Year's that

963.32.text:
it can sound like a warzone.
Obviously, a holiday this chaotic, violent

969.74.text:
and dangerous does not reflect God's command
to "Let all things be done decently and in

976.96.text:
order." Again, true Christians recognize this
about New Year's celebrations---and avoid

982.80.text:
them. They know that they must live "by every
word that proceeds out of the mouth of God"---and

988.43.text:
that man cannot rely on himself to determine
good from evil because "the heart is deceitful

994.35.text:
above all things [God says], and desperately
wicked," and also "the way of man is not in

1002.53.text:
himself; it is not in man who walks to direct
his own steps." God states, "My thoughts are

1010.32.text:
not your thoughts, neither are your ways My
ways…as the heavens are higher than the

1015.56.text:
earth, so are My ways higher than your ways,
and My thoughts than your thoughts."

1021.63.text:
The Creator designed and gave life to human
beings. He knows how they should live. God

1028.13.text:
has given His creation an Instruction Manual
to help men live the way He originally intended

1033.51.text:
(see John 10:10). That "manual"---the Holy
Bible---is God's Word and His truth (John

1042.04.text:
17:17). It is filled with spiritual laws,
statutes, and judgments guided by perfect

1049.38.text:
spiritual knowledge, wisdom and understanding.
II Timothy states, "All scripture is given

1055.45.text:
by inspiration of God, and is profitable for
doctrine [that’s teaching], for reproof,

1063.02.text:
for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly

1069.09.text:
furnished unto all good works." Only God's
Word can accurately distinguish right from

1076.06.text:
wrong, righteousness (obedience to God's commandments---Psalm
119:172) from sin (breaking God's spiritual

1084.85.text:
laws---I John 3:4 and Romans 7:17).
God's people understand that, as the only

1092.42.text:
real standard of truth man can live by, Scripture
"cannot be broken."

1098.64.text:
But most people---including most thought-to-be
Christians---love and follow the ideas of

1104.38.text:
men. Jesus knew this, and warned, "This people
honors Me with their lips, but their heart

1111.01.text:
is far from Me. Howbeit in vain do they worship
Me, teaching for doctrines the commandments

1118.12.text:
of men. For laying aside the commandment of
God, you hold the tradition of men…Full

1125.25.text:
well you reject [meaning you know exactly
what you are doing] the commandment of God,

1130.94.text:
that you may keep your own tradition…making
the word of God of none effect through your

1136.66.text:
tradition."
God commands His people not to follow pagan

1141.05.text:
practices!
Let's ask: Are there biblical examples of

1145.03.text:
God's servants celebrating New Year's? What
about David---called a man after God's own

1150.73.text:
heart? Or Abraham---the father of the faithful?
Or Moses---or even Jesus Christ?

1157.40.text:
The answer to each is no. Nor is there any
biblical instruction to celebrate this day.

1165.27.text:
But that does not stop almost all professing
Christians from doing so. Society---including

1171.36.text:
millions who claim to follow Christ---ignores
God, in effect telling Him, "We will decide

1177.91.text:
what we should or should not do!" GOD'S people
actively search the Bible to learn His will.

1184.85.text:
Their life's mission is to live by God's Word
alone---not by the traditions of men, including

1190.80.text:
all pagan celebrations.
People can worship in ways that represent

1196.09.text:
things far different from what they sincerely
believe or intend. When they have observed

1201.49.text:
a practice for a long time they come to identify
with it, as though it were their own. They

1207.74.text:
become vested in it. When one tries to tell
them the truth---even presenting FACTS, EVIDENCE

1215.24.text:
and PROOF---and in the case of Bible truths,
SCRIPTURE---many become hostile---outright

1222.73.text:
angry!---that any would dare speak against
sacred personal beliefs.

1228.30.text:
The proof is overwhelming that popular holidays
are "traditions and commands of men"---condemned

1234.59.text:
by God!
Vast millions keep them, anyway!

1238.75.text:
In another passage, God makes absolutely clear
that He does not want His people mixing His

1244.28.text:
ways with any false ways. Let's read it: "What
thing soever I command you [God says], observe

1252.66.text:
to do IT: you shall not add thereto, nor diminish
from it." In other words, do exactly what

1260.33.text:
God says---not more, nor less!
When God instituted the Passover to Israel,

1266.97.text:
He also revealed to them His sacred calendar.
He said, "This month shall be unto you the

1272.67.text:
beginning of months: it shall be the first
month of the year to you." God's calendar

1278.90.text:
begins in the spring, between March and April
of this world's calendar system. Leviticus

1285.02.text:
23 reveals all the special Holy Days (annual
sabbaths) that Christians are to observe.

1291.48.text:
They are dictated by GOD'S calendar, not man's.
Although the Bible tells us when His calendar

1298.16.text:
year begins, God does not command---or suggest---or
even allow---that His followers ever throw

1305.07.text:
aside self-control for a night of partying.
His people understand the days they are commanded

1312.18.text:
to observe: Passover and the 7 Days of Unleavened
Bread (in the early spring)---the Feast of

1318.42.text:
Pentecost (or Firstfruits, in the late spring)---the
Feast of Trumpets (or Rosh Hashanah)---as

1324.51.text:
well as the Day of Atonement (or Yom Kippur),
the Feast of Tabernacles (Succoth), and the

1331.23.text:
Last Great Day all in the early fall. God
carefully explains when these days are to

1337.72.text:
be observed within His sacred calendar. Jesus
kept them, as did the apostles and the New

1343.88.text:
Testament Church. The true Church---the only
one Jesus established---has kept them for

1350.14.text:
2,000 years, since AD 31. Take time to review
this extensive list of verses.

1358.27.text:
Most who claim to be Christian believe that
these special annual Sabbaths are only for

1361.99.text:
the Jews. They prefer pagan holidays, instituted
in humanly devised calendars. True Christians

1368.93.text:
know better.
These same Christians realize that this world

1373.02.text:
belongs to Satan. He rules it thru mass deception
in the name of Jesus Christ. Here are two

1379.69.text:
passages you should never forget: "The great
dragon...that old serpent, called the Devil,

1386.90.text:
and Satan, which deceives the whole world,"
and "The god of this world has blinded the

1394.22.text:
minds of them which believe not." In Gen.
3, Satan misled Adam and Eve into eating from

1400.75.text:
the forbidden tree, thus cutting off their
offspring---mankind thru the ages---from God.

1407.52.text:
And Satan is the same evil spirit who misleads
man into committing every sin under the sun.

1414.23.text:
As long as the devil influences the nations
of the world, prior to the now imminent Return

1419.28.text:
of Jesus Christ, mankind will continue drowning
in sin---including heathen customs and practices,

1426.45.text:
which may seem harmless to the average person,
but in fact insult God and are a stench in

1433.01.text:
His nostrils.
This Satan-influenced world is about to collapse.

1438.14.text:
Speaking of the great religious and political
system that has deceived the entire world,

1442.80.text:
God declares, "Babylon the great is fallen,
is fallen, and is become the habitation of

1449.73.text:
[demons], and the hold of every foul spirit,
and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.

1456.14.text:
For all nations have drunk of the wine of
the wrath of her fornication, and the kings

1461.15.text:
of the earth have committed fornication with
her, and the merchants of the earth are waxed

1465.54.text:
rich through the abundance of her delicacies."
Make this passage personal! Determine to learn

1472.66.text:
and understand who it is that God is speaking
of here. My booklet Who or What Is the Beast

1479.06.text:
of Revelation? will leave you in shock about
what you did not know.

1485.19.text:
Speaking of Babylon in context, God commands
all of His people to "Come out of her [the

1490.83.text:
ways of this world]…that you be not partakers
of her sins, and that you receive not of her

1497.36.text:
plagues."
Jesus told His disciples, "You are not of

1501.88.text:
the world, but I have chosen you out of the
world..." Though they must live in it, Jesus'

1509.66.text:
disciples today are not---and cannot be---OF
this world!

1516.66.text:
New Year's Eve and New Year's Day originate
from this pagan, Satan-influenced world. They,

1523.02.text:
with many other pagan holidays, were designed
to deceive mankind as a whole by appealing

1528.50.text:
to fleshly, carnal desires---or what the Bible
calls works of the flesh. "The works of the

1534.80.text:
flesh are [obvious, Paul wrote], which are
these: adultery, fornication, uncleanness,

1540.75.text:
lasciviousness, idolatry, witchcraft, hatred,
variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions,

1547.03.text:
heresies, envyings, murders, drunkenness,
revelings, and such like."

1555.58.text:
To any honest person, much of this list sounds
like a description of New Year's.

1561.85.text:
The next verse in Galatians declares, "They
which do such things shall not inherit the

1567.39.text:
kingdom of God." Those truly serving God have
their minds focused on God's kingdom (read

1575.33.text:
Matt. 6:33)---not fleshly cravings of this
world. They strive to "put off the old man"

1582.55.text:
and actively imitate the perfect, righteous
example of Christ. They are to dedicate themselves

1588.40.text:
to God and His way of life. They allow God's
Word to direct and guide every thought and

1595.51.text:
action. They understand that they come out
of the world---I repeat, including its pagan

1600.95.text:
customs, practices and traditions. New Year's
is no exception.

1607.12.text:
To learn more about what God says regarding
His Holy Days and men's holidays, read our
